input: I want to share with you a few simulations that model how an epidemic spreads.
from_community_srt: Želim s Vama podijeliti nekoliko jednostavnih simulacija koje modeliraju širenje epidemije.

input: There have recently been a few wonderful interactive articles in this vein, including one in the Washington Post by Harry Stevens, and then another by Kevin Simler over at Melting Asphalt.
from_community_srt: Nedavno se pojavilo nekoliko krasnih interaktivnih članaka iz ovog područja, uključujući i jedan u Washington Postu, od strane Harry Stevensa i drugi od Kevin Simlera iz Melting Asphalta Odlični su,

input: They are great, you can play with them, they're very informative, I'll of course leave links in the description.
from_community_srt: možete se s njima igrati, veoma su informativni, i naravno ostaviti ću poveznice u opisu.

input: After seeing those, I had a few more questions.
from_community_srt: Nakon što sam ih vidio, imao sam još nekoliko pitanja.

input: Like if people stay away from each other, I get that that's going to slow down the spread.
from_community_srt: Primjerice, ako se ljudi klone jedni drugih, shvaćam da će to usporiti širenje,

input: But what if despite mostly staying away from each other, people still occasionally go to a central location, like a grocery store or a school?
from_community_srt: ali što ako unatoč izbjegavanju drugih ljudi, neki ipak povremeno odu na središnju lokaciju, kao što je dućan s namirnicama ili škola? Također,

input: Also, what if you're able to identify and isolate the cases?
from_community_srt: što ako možete identificirati i izolirati te slučajeve? Te ukoliko možete,

input: And if you can, what if a few slip through, say because they don't show symptoms so they aren't tested?
from_community_srt: što ako neki promaknu,

input: How does travel between separate communities affect things?
from_community_srt: jer primjerice ne pokazuju simptome i stoga nisu testirani? Kako na stvari utječu putovanja između zajednica?

input: And what if people avoid contact with each other for a while, but then they kind of get tired and stop?
from_community_srt: I što ako ljudi izbjegavaju kontakt s drugima neko vrijeme,

input: We'll explore these questions and more, but first let's walk through how exactly these models will work.
from_community_srt: ali se potom umore i prestanu? Istražiti ćemo ova i neka druga pitanja, ali pogledajmo najprije kako će točno naši modeli funkcionirati.

input: Each simulation represents what's called an SIR model, meaning the population is broken up into three categories, those who are susceptible to getting the disease, those who are infectious, and then those who have recovered from the infection, so people who are immune don't play into it.
from_community_srt: Svaka simulacija predstavlja nešto što se zove "SIR model", što znači da je populacija podijeljena u tri kategorije, oni koji su podložni (S - Susceptible) obolijevanju od bolesti, oni koji su zarazni (I - Infectious), i oni koji su se oporavili od infekcije (R - Recovered). Način na koji sam ovo napisao,

input: The way I've written these, for every unit of time that a susceptible person spends within a certain infection radius of someone with the disease, they'll have some probability of contracting it themselves, so we're using physical proximity as a stand-in for things like shaking hands, touching the same surface, kissing, sneezing on each other, all that good stuff.
from_community_srt: za svaku jedinicu vremena koju prijemčiva osoba provede u određenom "zaraznom radijusu" nekoga tko je bolestan, imati će određenu vjerojatnost da se i sama zarazi. Stoga koristimo fizičku bliskost kao zamjenicu za pojave poput rukovanja, dodirivanja istih površina, ljubljenja, kihanja na druge,

input: Then for each infectious person, after some amount of time they'll recover and no longer be able to spread the disease, or if they die they won't be able to spread it anymore, so as a more generic term, sometimes people consider the R in SIR to stand for removed.
from_community_srt: sve te "dobre" stvari. Zatim za svaku zaraznu osobu, nakon nekog vremena će se oporaviti i neće više moći širiti bolest. Ili ako umru, također više neće moći širiti bolest, stoga kao više generički pojam ponekad ljudi smatraju da "R" u "SIR" stoji za "uklonjen" (R - removed).

input: This should go without saying, but let me emphasize it at the start anyway.
from_community_srt: Ovo ni ne bi trebalo govoriti, ali svejedno ću naglasiti:

input: These are toy models, with a tiny population, inevitably falling far short of the complexities in real people and larger populations.
from_community_srt: ovo su jednostavni modeli sa sićušnom populacijom te time neizbježno pojednostavljuju kompleksnost stvarnih osoba i većih populacija.

input: I am not an epidemiologist, so I would be very hesitant to generalize any of the lessons here without deeper consideration.
from_community_srt: Ja nisam epidemiolog pa sam jako nesklon uopćavanju ovih pouka bez pomnijeg razmatranja.

input: That said, I think it can be healthy to engage the little scientist inside all of us and take the chance to be experimental and quantitative, even if it's in a necessarily limited fashion, especially if the alternative is to dwell on headlines and uncertainty.
from_community_srt: Međutim, mislim da bi moglo biti zdravo angažirati malog znanstvenika u svima nama i iskoristiti priliku za biti eksperimentalan i kvantitativan čak i ako je to u nužno ograničenom obliku, posebice ako je alternativa zdvajati nad naslovima i neizvjesnosti.

input: We'll start things simple and layer on more complexity gradually.
from_community_srt: Započeti ćemo jednostavno i dodavati slojeve složenosti postupno.

input: In these first few runs that you're looking at, everybody is simply meandering around the city in a kind of random walk, and the infection follows the rules we've laid out.
from_community_srt: U ovih prvih nekoliko primjera koje gledate, svi jednostavno krivudaju gradom u nekakvoj nasumičnoj šetnji, a infekcija slijedi pravila koja smo izložili.

input: So it doesn't look great, after not too long almost everybody gets infected.
from_community_srt: Dakle... ne izgleda sjajno. Nakon kratkog vremena gotovo svi budu zaraženi.

input: As a sanity check, what would you expect to happen if I double this radius of infection?
from_community_srt: Kao provjera zdravog razmišljanja,

input: You might think of this as representing more total interactions between people, or a more socially engaged society.
from_community_srt: što očekujete da će se dogoditi ako povećam ovaj promjer zaraze? Možete razmišljati o ovome kao da predstavlja više ukupnih interakcija između ljudi, ili više društveno angažirano društvo.

input: It'll spread more quickly, of course, but how much?
from_community_srt: Širiti će se brže,

input: It's actually very drastic.
from_community_srt: naravno, ali koliko? Zapravo je veoma drastično!

input: Within a short time span, the majority of our little population is infected simultaneously.
from_community_srt: Unutar kratkog vremenskog raspona, većina naše male populacije zaražena je istovremeno.

input: As another sanity check, what would you expect if we go back to the original infection radius, and then cut the probability of infection in half?
from_community_srt: Kao još jedna provjera razmišljanja, što očekujete ako se vratimo na početni promjer zaraze i zatim prepolovimo vjerojatnost zaraze?

input: Remember, the way this is running, for each day that a susceptible person is within that radius of an infectious person, they have some probability of becoming infected.
from_community_srt: Zapamtite, ovo je postavljeno tako da za svaki dan u kojem je prijemčiva osoba unutar promjera zaraze zarazne osobe, prijemčiva osoba ima neku vjerojatnost zaraze,

input: By default I've set it to 20%, but this is the number we're now going to cut in half.
from_community_srt: koju sam zadao na 20%. no to je broj koji ćemo sada prepoloviti.

input: You might think of this as better hand washing, better cough protection, and less face touching.
from_community_srt: O ovome možete razmišljati kao o boljem pranju ruku,

input: As you might expect, it spreads out the curve.
from_community_srt: boljoj zaštiti tijekom kašljanja i manje dodirivanja lica. Kao što ste mogli očekivati, ovo je raširilo krivulju.

input: In fact it does this by quite a lot, which really illustrates how changes to hygiene have very large effects on the rate of spreading.
from_community_srt: Zapravo, to čini dosta, i time zaista ilustrira koliko promjene u higijeni mogu imati jako velike učinke na stopu širenja.

input: The first of several key takeaways here that I'd like you to tuck away in your mind is just how sensitive this growth can be to each parameter in our control.
from_community_srt: Prva od nekoliko ključnih poruka koju bi volio da pohranite je - koliko zapravo osjetljiv ovaj rast može biti na svaki od parametara koji je pod našom kontrolom.

input: It's not that hard to imagine changing your daily habits in a way that multiplies the number of people you interact with, or that cuts your probability of catching an infection in half, but the implications for the pace of the spread are huge.
from_community_srt: Nije toliko teško zamisliti promjenu dnevnih navika na način da umnožavaju broj osoba s kojim ste u interakciji ili da upola umanjuju vašu vjerojatnost zaraze; ali implikacije za ritam ovog širenja su ogromne.

input: The goal is probably to reduce the total number of people who die, which is some proportion of this removed category in the end.
from_community_srt: Cilj je vjerojatno smanjiti ukupni broj ljudi koji umiru, što je će činiti jedan udio ove "uklonjenje" (eng.

input: That proportion is not a constant, though.
from_community_srt: removed) kategorije na kranju No ta proporcija nije konstanta.

input: If you get to a point where the peak of the infection curve is too high, meaning there's a time when many people are all sick at once, that's the point when available healthcare resources are overwhelmed, which for a bad disease will increase the mortality rate.
from_community_srt: Ako dođete do točke gdje je vrhunac ove krivulje zaraze previsok, što znači da postoji vrijeme kada je puno ljudi bolesno istovremeno, to je točka kada su dostupni zdravstveni resursi preplavljeni, što će za tešku bolest povećati stopu smrtnosti.

input: Now I don't know where you're from, but in most towns people don't actually spend their days drunkenly wandering around the city like this.
from_community_srt: Ja ne znam odakle ste Vi, ali u većini gradova ljudi zapravo ne provode dana pijano lutajući gradom ovako.

input: Often there's a common destination, like a central market or a school.
from_community_srt: Često postoji zajedničko odredište, kao što je središnja tržnica ili škola.

input: In our model, if we introduce some central spot like this that people regularly visit and then return from, it's… well, just look.
from_community_srt: U našem modelu, ako uključimo takvu središnju točku koju ljudi redovito posjećuju i zatim se iz nje vraćaju, onda je... dakle...

input: One of the main things I was curious about is how to mitigate this effect, and that's something we'll examine in just a bit.
from_community_srt: pogledajmo. Jedna od glavnih stvari oko koje sam bio znatiželjan je kako ublažiti ovaj učinak, a to je nešto što ćemo istražiti uskoro.

input: Another feature we could include is to have a few separate communities with transit between them.
from_community_srt: Još jedno svojstvo koje možemo uključiti je da imamo nekoliko odvojenih zajednica, sa putovanjima između njih.

input: Every day, each person will have some probability of traveling to the center of another community, and then going about their usual routine from there.
from_community_srt: Svakoga dana, svaka osoba imati će nekakvu vjerojatnost putovanja u središte druge zajednice, i zatim od tamo ići za uobičajenom rutinom.

input: All of that is our basic setup, so now the question is what actions help to stop this spread?
from_community_srt: Sve ovo su naše temeljne postavke,

input: What is by far most effective is to identify and isolate whoever is infectious, for example with good testing and quick responsiveness.
from_community_srt: a sada je pitanje koje mjere pomažu zaustavljanju ovog širenja? Ono što je nadaleko najučinkovitije je identificirati i izolirati svakoga tko je zarazan, primjerice dobrim testiranjem i brzim odgovorom.

input: In our simulations, once we hit some critical threshold of cases, we're going to start sending people to a separate location one day after they have the infection.
from_community_srt: U našim simulacijama, jednom kada dosegnemo kritični prag slučajeva, početi ćemo slati ljude na odvojenu lokaciju jedan dan nakon što su se zarazili.

input: This is of course a stand-in for whatever isolation would look like in the real world, it doesn't have to literally be transporting all the sick people into one sad box.
from_community_srt: Ovo je, naravno, samo zamjena za ono kako bi izolacija izgledala u stvarnom svijetu; ne mora doslovno značiti premještanje svih bolesnih u jednu kutiju s pijeskom.

input: Unsurprisingly, this totally halts the epidemic in its tracks.
from_community_srt: Neiznenađujuće, ovo potpuno zaustavlja epidemiju.

input: But what if when you're infected you have a 20% chance of not getting quarantined, say because you show no symptoms so you don't get tested, and you go about your day as usual?
from_community_srt: Ali što ako, kad ste zaraženi, imate 20% vjerojatnosti da niste stavljeni u karantenu,

input: We're going to illustrate these people that have no symptoms using yellow circles instead of red.
from_community_srt: primjerice zbog toga jer nemate simptome i niste testirani pa provodite dane kao i inače? Prikazati ćemo te ljude koji nemaju nikakve simptome koristeći žute krugove umjesto crvenih.

input: Obviously this will have a result somewhere between a total quarantine and doing nothing, but where on the spectrum would you predict it'll be?
from_community_srt: Očito, ovo će imati rezultat negdje između potpune karantene i činjenja ničega, ali gdje na tom spektru bi predvidjeli da će biti?

input: The peak number of simultaneous cases is only a little bit higher, but there is a very low long tail as it takes a much longer time to stamp out, resulting in about twice as many total cases.
from_community_srt: Vršni broj istovremenih slučajeva je samo mrvicu veći, ali vidljiv je dugačak rep, pošto je potrebno mnogo duže da se ugasi, rezultirajući otprilike dvostruko većim brojem slučajeva.

input: This gets more interesting when we do it in a setting with many communities and transit between them.
from_community_srt: Ovo postaje zanimljivije kada postavimo u okruženje sa mnogo zajednica i putovanjima između njih.

input: Again, totally effective tracking in isolation stops the epidemic very quickly, but what would you predict is going to happen if now 20% of the infectious cases slip through that process?
from_community_srt: Ponovno, potpuno učinkovito praćenje i izolacija zaustavlja epidemiju vrlo brzo, ali što bi Vi predvidjeli da će se dogoditi ako sada 20% zaraznih slučajeva promakne ovom procesu?

input: Again, I've set things to wait until a certain critical threshold of cases is hit before our little dot society kicks into gear and takes action.
from_community_srt: Ponovno, pustio sam da stvari čekaju dok određeni kritični prag slučajeva nije dosegnuti, prije nego li se naše malo društvo točaka pokrene i poduzme mjere.

input: As a side note, it's a little interesting that even when all the parameters are the same, some runs take three times longer to reach this point than others.
from_community_srt: Kao usputna opaska, zanimljivo je kako, čak i kad su svi parametri isti, nekim ponavljanjima (modela) treba tri puta duže nego drugima da bi dosegnula ovu točku;

input: Before the law of large numbers kicks in, that pace of growth can have as much to do with the roll of the dice as it does with anything intrinsic to the disease itself.
from_community_srt: prije nego li se ubaci zakon velikih brojeva taj ritam rasta može imati jednako veze sa bacanjem kocki kao što ima sa bilo čime intrinzičnim samoj bolesti.

input: This leaky quarantining effort definitely flattens out the curve, but it is a much thicker tail and takes a much longer time to track down all the cases, with over half the population getting infected this time.
from_community_srt: Ovaj napor "cureće" karantene definitivno izravnava krivulju, ali sada je puno deblji rep i potrebno je puno više vremena da bi se pronašlo sve slučajeve, sa više od pola populacije zaražene ovoga puta.

input: Now, what would you predict if it was only 50% of the infectious cases that were isolated like this?
from_community_srt: Što bi sada predvidjeli ako je samo 50% zaraznih slučajeva ovako izolirano? Ako se polovica zaraznih osoba stavlja u karantenu,

input: If half the infectious people are getting quarantined, it doesn't mean that half the total population will end up with the disease.
from_community_srt: to ne znači da će pola ukupne populacije završiti bolesno.

input: Because there are so many agents still out there spreading it, we end up with a situation that's only barely better than if nothing had been done at all.
from_community_srt: Zbog toga što je toliko posrednika još uvijek tamo vani i šire bolest,

input: A second key takeaway here is that changes in how many people slip through the tests can cause disproportionately large changes to the total number of people infected.
from_community_srt: završavamo sa situacijom koja je samo neznatno bolja nego da uopće ništa nije učinjeno. Druga ključna poruka ovdje je da promjene u tome koliko ljudi promakne testiranju može uzrokovati nesrazmjerno velike promjene ukupnog broja zaraženih ljudi.

input: If we look back to the fact that quickly containing cases so early is so effective, it actually has an interesting corollary, which is that the most lethal diseases are in some sense less dangerous globally.
from_community_srt: Ako se vratimo na činjenicu da je brzo zatvaranje slučajeva rano toliko djelotvorno, to zapravo ima zanimljivu posljedicu, a to je da su najsmrtonosnije bolesti, u nekom smislu, manje opasne globalno.

input: Remember that the rule of this quarantine simulation is to send infectious people to a separate spot one day after they've been infected, but if the disease kills its host after one day, the model looks identical, it just has a much darker interpretation.
from_community_srt: Sjetite se da je pravilo u ovim simulacijama karantene da se zarazne ljude šalje na odvojeno mjesto jedan dan nakon što su inficirani, ali ako bolest ubije svog domaćina nakon jednog dana, model izgleda identično, samo ima puno mračniju interpretaciju.

input: It is terrible for those who get it, but it doesn't spread.
from_community_srt: Užasno je za one koji obole,

input: It also means that the most dangerous viruses are the ones that kill some part of the population in the first place, while laying unnoticed and spreadable among others.
from_community_srt: ali se ne širi. To također znači da su najopasniji virusi oni koji ubiju jedan dio populacije, istovremeno bivajući neprimijećeni i šireći među drugima.

input: Or worse yet, if they remain unnoticed and spreadable in everyone before eventually becoming lethal.
from_community_srt: Ili, još gore, ako ostanu neprimijećeni i šireći kod svih prije nego naposljetku postanu smrtonosni.

input: One of the reasons that the SARS outbreak in 2002 was so well contained is that just about everybody in this infectious population was showing symptoms, so they were much easier to identify and isolate.
from_community_srt: Jedan od razloga zbog kojega je epidemija SARS-a 2002. tako dobro obuzdana, je to što su gotovo svi u toj zaraznoj populaciji pokazivali simptome,

input: A more optimistic corollary of these quarantine simulations is how useful early treatment can be.
from_community_srt: stoga ih je bilo lakše identificirati i izolirati Optimističnija posljedica ovih simulacije karantene jest koliko korisno može biti rano liječenje.

input: If there exists an antiviral therapeutic that can move people out of this infectious category quickly, it has the same effect on the model as isolating those cases.
from_community_srt: Ako postoji antivirusni lijek koji može maknuti osobe iz ove zarazne kategorije brzo, to ima isti učinak na model kao i izoliranje tih slučajeva.

input: But let's say you don't have widespread testing or antiviral therapeutics.
from_community_srt: Ali recimo da nemate široko rasprostranjeno testiranje ili antivirusne lijekove.

input: Well, let's introduce a new parameter here, which is how much people try to avoid each other.
from_community_srt: Pa, hajdemo uključiti novi parametar ovdje, koji je koliko se ljudi trude međusobno se izbjegavati.

input: Let's call it the social distance factor.
from_community_srt: Nazvati ćemo ga "čimbenik društvenog udaljavanja".

input: In these animations, I'll apply it as a repulsive force between people, and have them glow yellow when they feel just a little too close to their neighbor.
from_community_srt: U ovim animacijama, primijeniti ću ga kao odbojnu silu između ljudi i učiniti da zasjaje žuto kada se osjete preblizu njihovom susjedu.

input: This has the sad but kind of cute effect that when our little agents are social distancing, they often end up trembling near the edge of their box.
from_community_srt: Ovo ima žalostan, ali na neki način dražestan učinak da kada se naši mali posrednici društveno udaljuju, često završe podrhtavajući blizu ruba njihove kutije.

input: No isolation is perfect, though, so every now and then even those repulsed by each other will jiggle close enough to get infected.
from_community_srt: Nijedna izolacija nije savršena, stoga svako malo čak će se i oni koje drugi odbijaju tresti dovoljno blizu da se zaraze;

input: The point is that those interactions are much rarer.
from_community_srt: suština je da su te interakcije puno rjeđe.

input: Let's take a look at four separate runs here.
from_community_srt: Pogledajmo četiri odvojene simulacije.

input: In each one of them, after we hit 50 cases, I'll turn on social distancing.
from_community_srt: U svakoj od njih, nakon što dosegnemo 50 slučajeva, uključiti ću društveno udaljavanje.

input: But in the top left, we'll turn it on for everybody.
from_community_srt: Ali gore lijevo uključiti ćemo za sve,

input: In the top right, we'll turn it on for 90% of the population.
from_community_srt: gore desno uključiti ćemo za 90% populacije.

input: In the bottom left, for 70% of the population, and in the bottom right, for only half the population.
from_community_srt: Dolje lijevo, za 70% populacije, a dolje desno, za samo polovicu populacije.

input: What would you predict is going to happen?
As you might expect, when 100% of people avoid each other, the disease quickly goes away, entirely.
from_community_srt: Što biste predvidjeli da će se dogoditi? Kao što bi očekivali, kada se 100% ljudi međusobno izbjegava, bolest brzo nestaje, u cijelosti.

input: And in all four cases, the presence of some kind of widespread social distancing definitely flattens out the curve.
from_community_srt: U sva četiri slučaja prisutnost nekakve vrste raširenog društvenog udaljavanja definitivno izravnava

input: However, in terms of the ultimate number of cases, the run with 70% and even the one with 90% end up with a little less than half the population ultimately getting infected, which is only a tiny bit better than the one with 50%.
from_community_srt: krivulju. Međutim, u smislu konačnog broja slučajeva, simulacija sa 70% pa čak i ona sa 90%, završavaju sa nešto malo manje od zaražene populacije na kraju, što je samo mrvicu bolje od one sa 50%.

input: That case with 90% of people repelling each other certainly takes longer to get there, but evidently a mere 10% of the population cheating adds enough instability to our system to keep the fire slowly burning for a long time.
from_community_srt: Onaj slučaj u kojem se 90% ljudi međusobno odbija, zasigurno treba dulje da se do njega dođe, ali očito samo 10% populacije koja vara, dodaje dovoljno nestabilnosti u naš sustav da vatra sporo gori dugo vremena.

input: Again, I'll emphasize that these are toy models, and I leave it to the intelligence of the viewer to judge if the behavior of these little dots accurately reflects what social distancing would mean for you and your life.
from_community_srt: Ponovno ću naglasiti da su ovo jednostavni modeli i ostavljam inteligenciji gledatelja da procijeni da li ponašanje ovih točaka vjerodostojno odražava što bi društveno udaljavanje značilo za Vas i Vaš život.

input: Someone fully sequestered in their home is not necessarily affected by the random jiggling of their neighbor, but then again, few of us genuinely live independently from everyone else.
from_community_srt: Netko u potpunosti izoliran u svojem domu nije nužno pogođen nasumičnim drmanjima svojih susjeda. No, s druge strane, malo nas živi uistinu neovisno od svih ostalih.

input: Insofar as these models aren't outlandish, the third key takeaway is that social distancing absolutely works to flatten the curve, but even small imperfections prolong the spread for a while.
from_community_srt: U mjeri u kojoj ovi modeli nisu čudnovati, treća ključna poruka je da društveno udaljavanje apsolutno vodi izravnanju krivulje, ali čak i male nesavršenosti produljuju širenje neko vrijeme.

input: Now let's look at that setup with 12 communities and travel between them.
from_community_srt: Idemo sada pogledati one postavke sa 12 zajednica i putovanjima između njih.

input: By default I have it set so that every day each agent has a 2% chance of traveling to the center of a different community.
from_community_srt: Zadao sam postavke tako da svaki posrednik ima 2% vjerojatnosti putovanja u središte druge zajednice.

input: Now let's try a run where once we hit 100 cases, we cut down that travel rate by a factor of 4, to only half a percent.
from_community_srt: Sada idemo pokušati simulaciju u kojoj, jednom kad dosegnemo 100 slučajeva, smanjimo stopu putovanja za faktor 4, na samo pola posto.

input: What would you predict is going to happen?
The honest answer is that it depends.
from_community_srt: Što biste predvidjeli da će se dogoditi? Iskreni odgovor je da ovisi.

input: In some runs it doesn't make any difference, and the majority of every community gets it.
from_community_srt: U nekim simulacijama, nema nikakve razlike i većina svake zajednice oboli.

input: Other times there are a couple communities that end up unscathed.
from_community_srt: U drugim simulacijama ima nekoliko zajednica koje završe neozlijeđene.

input: In general, the earlier you turn on this effect, the more effective it is, but the takeaway here is that reducing contact between communities really has only a limited effect once those communities already have it, and as solutions go it's certainly not robust on its own.
from_community_srt: Načelno, što ranije uključite ovaj učinak, djelotvorniji je, ali poruka ovdje je da smanjivanje kontakata između zajednica zapravo ima samo ograničeni učinak jednom kada te zajednice već imaju bolest, a što se tiče rješenja,

input: As a side note, when we run these simulations with larger cities, which has the effect that city centers act like concentrated urban hubs, you can see how as soon as the infection hits one of these urban centers, it very quickly hits all of them.
from_community_srt: sigurno nije snažno samo za sebe. Kao usputna opaska, kada simuliramo ove situacije u većim gradovima, što ima učinak da gradska središta djeluju kao koncentrirani urbani čvorovi, Možete vidjeti da kako, čim jednom infekcija pogodi jedan od tih urbanih središta,

input: And after that, it slowly spreads to the edges of each community.
from_community_srt: vrlo brzo pogodi ih sve, a nakon toga polako se širi na rubove svake zajednice.

input: Let's take a moment to talk about how to quantify this spread.
from_community_srt: Idemo na trenutak pričati o tome kako možemo kvantificirati širenje.

input: Consider one person with the disease, and then count how many people they infect while they have it.
from_community_srt: Razmotrite jednu oboljelu osobu i zatim pobrojite koliko drugih ljudi ona zarazi dok je bolesna.

input: The average for this count across everybody who's been sick is known as the effective reproductive number, or R.
from_community_srt: Prosjek ovog broja kod svih koji su bili bolesni poznat je kao efektivni reproduktivni broj ili R.

input: A more commonly discussed number is R-naught, which is the value of R in a fully susceptible population, like at the very beginning.
from_community_srt: Češće spominjani broj je R0, što je vrijednost R u potpuno prijemčivoj populaciji, kao što je to na samom početku.

input: This is known as the basic reproductive number.
from_community_srt: Ovo je poznato kao "temeljni" reproduktivni broj.

input: You may have noticed I have this little label on our simulations, and the way it's being calculated is to look at each individual who's currently infectious, count how many people they've infected so far, estimate how many they're going to infect in total based on the duration of the illness, and then average those numbers.
from_community_srt: Možda se primijetili, imam ovu malu oznaku na našim simulacijama i način na koji se računa je da se gleda svakog pojedinca koji je trenutno zarazan, pobroji koliko je ljudi zarazio do sada, procijeni koliko će ljudi zaraziti ukupno, na temelju trajanja bolesti i zatim uprosječi te brojeve.

input: For example, in our first default simulation with no added spices, R is around 2.2 at the highest part of the growth phase, before falling down as the population becomes saturated.
from_community_srt: Na primjer, u našoj prvoj simulaciji sa uobičajenim postavkama bez dodanih začina, R je oko 2.2 u najvišem dijelu faze rasta, prije padanja kako populacija postane zasićena.

input: By contrast, when we doubled the infection radius, R was as high as 8!
from_community_srt: Nasuprot tome, kada smo udvostručili zarazni promjer,

input: This factor has a huge effect on the growth rate.
from_community_srt: R je dosegao 8! Ovaj čimbenik imao ogromni učinak na stopu rasta.

input: It should kind of make sense that it jumped up as high as 8, though.
from_community_srt: Trebalo bi imati smisla da je skočilo na 8;

input: When you double that radius, there's about 4 times as many people inside it to infect.
from_community_srt: kada udvostručiš taj promjer, ima otprilike 4 puta više ljudi unutra koji se mogu zaraziti.

input: When we chopped the infection rate in half, it hovered around the 1.3 to 1.7 range.
from_community_srt: Kada smo srezali stopu zaraznosti na pola, lebdjela je oko raspona 1.3 do 1.7.

input: While R is greater than 1, the infection is growing exponentially, and it's at that point that it's known as an epidemic.
from_community_srt: Dok je R veći od 1, infekcija raste eksponencijalno i od tog trenutka poznata je kao "epidemija".

input: When it holds steady around 1, that's when a disease is called endemic, and less than 1 means it's on the decline.
from_community_srt: Kada se kreće mirno oko 1, tada se bolest zove "endemska". A manje od 1 znači da je u opadanju.

input: For comparison, R0 for COVID-19 is estimated to be a little above 2, which is also around what the mean estimate for R0 was during the 1918 Spanish flu pandemic.
from_community_srt: Za usporedbu, R0 za COVID-19 je procijenjen nešto malo iznad 2, što je također oko onoga što je srednja procjena R0 bila za vrijeme pandemije Španjolske gripe 1918.

input: The seasonal flu by comparison is much lower, around 1.3.
from_community_srt: Sezonska gripa je, za usporedbu, mnogo niža, oko 1.3.

input: In the travel case, as soon as we turn on social distancing and shut down travel, you can see R quickly drop down from 2.
from_community_srt: U slučaju putovanja, čim uključimo društveno udaljavanje i isključimo putovanja, možete vidjeti kako R brzo pada od 2.

input: There's a little bit of a lag between the change we make to the model and the value of this number, since it's calculated based on current infectious cases, which might have existed prior to the method being put in place.
from_community_srt: Postoji malo zaostajanje između promjene koje unosimo u model i vrijednosti ovog broja, pošto se računa na temelju trenutnih zaraznih slučajeva,

input: Like I said at the start, one of the things I was most curious about is the effect of some kind of shared central location, like a market or a school.
from_community_srt: koji su mogli postojati prije nego je metoda implementirana Kao što sam rekao na početku, jedna od stvari oko koje sam najviše bio znatiželjan bila je učinak nekakve vrste zajedničke središnje lokacije, kao što je tržnica ili škola.

input: When I introduce such a destination for our little dots, R0 jumps as high as 5.8.
from_community_srt: Kada predstavim takvo odredište našim malim točkama,

input: This might be a little unfair, since it puts everyone right in the same spot, and given that we're using physical proximity as a stand-in for things like shaking hands or kissing, we should maybe acknowledge that people going to the same school or grocery store are not as likely to spread an infection as, say, close friends or people living in the same house.
from_community_srt: R0 skoči do 5.8 Ovo bi moglo biti malo nepošteno, pošto sve stavlja na točno isto mjesto, i s obzirom da koristimo fizičku bliskost kao zamjenu za stvari poput rukovanja ili ljubljenja, moramo možda priznati da ljudi koji idu u istu školu ili isti dućan nemaju jednaku vjerojatnost širenja zaraze kao, primjerice, bliski prijatelji ili ljudi koji žive u istoj kući.

input: To account for this, let's conservatively cut the probability of infection per day in half.
from_community_srt: Kako bi to uzeli u obzir, konzervativno ćemo srezati vjerojatnost infekcije po danu na pola.

input: This does indeed cut R0 in half, but the effect of a central market remains dramatic.
from_community_srt: Ovo zaista cijepa vršnu vrijednost R0 na pola, ali učinak središnje tržnice ostaje dramatičan.

input: Now let's try a run where after some threshold is hit, we turn on social distancing, but people still go to that central location the way they did before.
from_community_srt: Idemo sada isprobati simulaciju u kojoj, nakon što je dosegnut određeni prag, uključimo društveno udaljavanje, ali ljudi još uvijek odlaze na tu središnju lokaciju,

input: You may notice that some of our little dots seem to have escaped their little cage, which was not supposed to happen, but I'm going to make the conscious choice not to fix that.
from_community_srt: kao što su to radili i prije. Možda se primijetili da su neke točke pobjegle iz njihovog malog kaveza... što se nije trebalo dogoditi, ali napraviti ću svjesni izbor i ne popraviti to.

input: It's like they all looked at the chaos inside and just went, nope, I'm out, I don't want any part of that.
from_community_srt: Čini se kao da su sve pogledate kaos unutra i rekle "Ne,

input: Living in the Bay Area during a shelter-in-place order, I can confirm that this is how some people react.
from_community_srt: izlazim!" "Ne želim biti dio toga!" Živeći u zaljevskom području za vrijeme naloga da se sklonimo na mjestu, mogu potvrditi da neki ljudi tako reagiraju.

input: Wandering dots aside, let me show you how this graph compares to the control case where we did nothing, and how it compares to what would have happened if in addition to repelling from each other, all the dots also stopped going to that central location.
from_community_srt: Lutajuće točke na stranu, pokazati ću Vam kako se ovaj grafikon uspoređuje sa kontrolnim slučajem, gdje nismo radili ništa, a kako se uspoređuje sa onim što bi se dogodilo da su, osim što se odbijaju jedna od druge, sve točke također prestale odlaziti na tu središnju lokaciju.

input: The peak of the infection curve is a little lower than the control, but in terms of the total number of cases, keeping that central location active really defeats the effects of otherwise social distancing.
from_community_srt: Vrhunac krivulje zaraze nešto je niži od kontrole, ali u smislu ukupnog broja slučajeva, održavajući tu središnju lokaciju aktivnom, zaista poništava učinke ostalog društvenog udaljavanja.

input: Now let me ask you to make a prediction.
from_community_srt: A sada ću Vas zamoliti za predviđanje.

input: What do you think will be more effective?

If on top of that social distancing effect, we decrease the frequency with which people go to that central spot, maybe by a factor of 5, or if we chop the probability of infection down by another factor of 2, meaning people are super extra cautious about washing their hands and not touching their face.
from_community_srt: Što mislite da će biti učinkovitije? Ako na učinak društvenog udaljavanja smanjimo učestalost s kojom ljudi odlaze na tu središnju točku, možda za čimbenik 5? Ili ako srežemo vjerojatnost zaraze za dodatni čimbenik 2, što bi, primjerice, značilo da su ljudi super posebno oprezni oko pranja ruku i ne diranja lica.

input: The simulation on the left requires our dots to very heavily alter their daily routines, whereas on the right our dots can mostly continue their usual habits, but are much more conscious of hygiene.
from_community_srt: Simulacija na lijevoj strani zahtijeva od naših točaka da temeljito promijene dnevne rutine, dok s desne strane naše točke mogu uglavnom nastaviti s dnevnim navikama,

input: They're actually nearly identical, which surprised me, given that one of them is a fivefold decrease and the other is twofold.
from_community_srt: samo su puno savjesnije oko higijene. Zapravo su gotovo identične, što me iznenadilo, s obzirom da je jedna od njih peterostruko smanjenje, a druga je dvostruko.

input: I guess it goes to show that the effect of hygiene, which is maybe easier said than done, really goes a long way.
from_community_srt: Pretpostavljam da ovo pokazuje da je učinak higijene, što je vjerojatno lakše reći nego učiniti, zaista značajan.

input: Of course, it doesn't have to be an either-or.
from_community_srt: Naravno, to ne treba biti ili-ili;

input: Our goal with these experiments is to look at the effects of one change at a time.
from_community_srt: naš cilj s ovim eksperimentima je promatrati učinak promjena jednu po jednu.

input: If you're curious, here's what it looks like when we apply social distancing, we restrict the rate that people go to the central location, and we also lower the infection rate all at once.
from_community_srt: Ako ste znatiželjni, ovako izgleda kada primijenimo društveno udaljavanje, ograničimo stopu ljudi koja odlazi na središnju lokaciju i također snizimo stopu zaraze,

input: This combination is, indeed, very effective.
from_community_srt: sve odjednom. Ova kombinacija je, zaista,

input: But I want to emphasize again how the most desirable case is when you can consistently identify and isolate cases.
from_community_srt: vrlo učinkovita. Ali želio bih ponovno naglasiti kako je najpoželjniji slučaj onaj u kojem možete konzistentno identificirati i izolirati slučajeve.

input: Even in this central market simulation, which left unchecked gives a huge conflagration, being able to do this effectively still halts the epidemic, and our little dots don't even have to be repelled by each other or stop their trips to the central spot.
from_community_srt: Čak i u ovoj simulaciji središnje tržnice, koja, ako je nekontrolirana, daje ogromni požar, mogućnost provođenja ovih mjera učinkovito, još uvijek zaustavlja epidemiju. I, naše male točke čak se i ne moraju međusobno odbijati ili prestati s odlascima na središnju točku

input: In real epidemiology, by the way, it gets way more sophisticated than this, with tactics like contact tracing, where you not only identify and isolate known cases, but you do the same for everyone who's been in contact with those cases.
from_community_srt: U pravoj epidemiologiji, usput rečeno, postaje puno sofisticiranije od ovoga, sa taktikama poput "praćenja kontakata", gdje ne samo da identificirate i izolirate poznate slučajeve, nego radite isto za svakoga tko je bio u kontaktu s tim slučajevima.

input: Given the time I'm posting this, I imagine there's some expectation for it to be a PSA on social distancing.
from_community_srt: S obzirom na vrijeme u kojem ovo objavljujem, mogu zamisliti da postoje očekivanja da će biti javna objava o društvenom udaljavanju.

input: But to be honest, that's not really my own main takeaway.
from_community_srt: No, da budem iskren, to nije zapravo moja glavna poruka.

input: To be clear, when it's needed, like it is now, social distancing absolutely saves lives, and as we saw earlier, when people cheat or when they continue to regularly meet at a central spot, it has a disproportionate effect on the long-term number of cases.
from_community_srt: Da budemo jasni, kada je potrebno, kao što je to sada, društveno udaljavanje apsolutno spašava živote, i, kao što smo vidjeli ranije, kada ljudi varaju, ili se nastavljaju redovno susretati na središnjem mjestu, ima neproporcionalni učinak na dugoročni broj slučajeva.

input: The uncomfortable truth, though, is that while the disease still exists, as soon as people let up and they go back to their normal lives, if nothing is in place to contain the cases, few though they might be, you'll just get a second wave.
from_community_srt: Neugodna je istina da, dok bolest još postoji, čim ljudi popuste i vrate se normalnim životima, ako nema ničega što bi zadržalo slučajeve iako ih bilo malo, imati ćemo drugi val.

input: After making all of these, what I came away with more than anything else was a deeper appreciation for disease control done right, for the inordinate value of early widespread testing and the ability to isolate cases, for therapeutics that treat these cases, and most importantly, for how easy it is to underestimate all that value when times are good.
from_community_srt: Nakon što sam sve ovo napravio, što sam naučio više od svega je dublja zahvalnost za ispravno provođenje kontrole bolesti; za nemjerljivu vrijednost ranog rasprostranjenog testiranja i mogućnosti izolacije slučajeva; za lijekove koji liječe ove slučajeve i, najvažnije od svega, kako je jednostavno podcijeniti svu tu vrijednost kada su vremena dobra.

input: I'm writing this during a pandemic, when some viewers may be able to identify a little too well with the trembling dots retreating to the edge of their box.
from_community_srt: Pišem ovo za vrijeme pandemije, kada će se neki gledatelji moći mrvicu predobro identificirati sa drhtavim točkama koji se povlače prema rubu svoje kutije.

input: But in the future, many people will be watching this during a pandemic that never was, a time when a novel pathogen that could have spread widely if left unchecked was instead swiftly found and contained.
from_community_srt: Ali u budućnosti mnogi ljudi gledati će ovo za vrijeme pandemije koja se nikada nije dogodila; vrijeme kada će se novi patogen, koji se mogao proširiti brzo da nije prepoznat, umjesto toga brzo pronaći i obuzdati.

input: Those would-be pandemics never make it into the history books, which is maybe why we don't value the heroes behind them the way we should.
from_community_srt: Te moguće pandemije nikada se ne pojavljuju u povijesnim knjigama, što je možda razlog zbog kojeg ne cijenimo heroje u pozadini na način na koji bi trebali.

input: Living in a world with widespread travel and vibrant urban centers does make fighting the spread of a disease an uphill battle, that's absolutely true.
from_community_srt: Život u Svijetu sa rasprostranjenim putovanjima i treperavim urbanim središtima čin borbu protiv širenja bolesti bitkom na uzbrdici, to je apsolutno istinito.

input: But that same level of connectedness means that ideas spread more quickly than ever, ideas that can lead to systems and technologies that nip these outbreaks in the bud.
from_community_srt: Ali ista ta razina povezanosti znači da se ideje šire brže nego ikad, ideje koje mogu voditi do sustava i tehnologija koje otkidaju ova izbijanja bolesti dok još pupaju.

input: It won't happen on its own, and it's clear that we sometimes make mistakes, but I'm fundamentally optimistic about our ability to learn from those mistakes.
from_community_srt: Neće se dogoditi samo od sebe i jasno je da ponekad griješimo, ali temeljno sam optimističan oko naših sposobnosti učenja iz tih pogrešaka.

input: As you might imagine, these videos require a lot of hours of effort.
from_community_srt: Kao što možete zamisliti, ove snimke zahtijevaju puno sati truda.

input: I don't do any ad reads at the end, and YouTube content related to the current pandemic seems to be systematically demonetized, so I just want to take this chance to say a particularly warm thank you to those who support them directly on Patreon.
from_community_srt: Ne čitam oglase na kraj i čini se YouTube sadržaj vezan za sadašnju pandemiju sustavno demonetiziran. Pa bi stoga iskoristio ovu priliku da izrazim posebno toplu zahvalu onima koji ih podupiru izravno na Patreon-u.

input: It really does make a difference.
from_community_srt: Zaista čini razliku.
